sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"小说，故事"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: novel, romance, fiction, story, fable, tale
means: novel ： 指任何有情节、人物、对白，虚构的长篇散文体故事。
romance系novel早期的代用词，泛指具有强烈神话和传奇色彩的故事，现指爱情故事。
fiction ： 指部分或全部虚构的短篇、中篇、长篇小说，也指传奇故事，是小说的总称。
story ： 指篇幅较短，常包含一系列情节或事件，口述或书写成文的故事。
fable ： 指短小而寓有教育意义的虚构故事。故事的主人公多为拟人化的动物或非动物之类。也作传说解。
tale常可与story换用，指以事实为中心作叙述的故事，也指古代流传下来的传说故事或神话故事。

sentence.Network_en: She probably sensed that I wasn'ttelling her the whole story.
sentence.Network_cn: 她可能意识到了我并没有对她全盘托出。

sentence.Network_en: The story ascends from a gothic tragedy to a miraculous fairy-tale.
sentence.Network_cn: 故事从一个哥特式悲剧升华为神奇的童话。

sentence.Network_en: Lucilla often asks her sisters to retell the story.
sentence.Network_cn: 露西拉经常要姐姐们把这个故事反复讲给她听。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used after raising a matter to indicate that one does not want to expand on it for now
(informal)used to emphasize that there is nothing to add on a matter just mentioned
jx.jx_cn_mean: (非正式)就是这个样子，仅此而已

lj.lj_ly: Men don't cry in public. End of story.
lj.lj_ls: 男人不会在公共场合哭泣。就是这样。

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to indicate that, for now, one does not want to talk about something that is too painful and involved

phrase.cizu_name: it's (或 that's) the story of one's life

jx.jx_en_mean: (informal)used to lament the fact that a particular misfortune has happened too often in one's experience
used to indicate that a particular bad situation is tediously familiar

lj.lj_ly: United kept on trying but it was the same old sotry—no luck.
lj.lj_ls: 虽然联队一直在努力，但还是老样子，运气不佳。

lj.lj_ly: &B{the story goes that} he's fallen out with his friends.
lj.lj_ls: 据说他跟他的朋友们闹翻了。

jx.jx_en_mean: used to end an account of events quickly

lj.lj_ly: to cut a long story short, I married Stephen.
lj.lj_ls: 长话短说，我和斯蒂芬结婚了。

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (denoting a historical account or representation): shortening of Anglo-Norman French estorie, from Latin historia (see history)

encyclopedia.content: 词语信息 词语：story ['stɔ:ri] 复数：stories 过去式：storied 过去分词：storied 现在分词：storying 释义 n. 1. 故事；传说 2. 小说，锛堄戎革級短篇小说 3. 逸事，趣闻；传闻 4. 锛埿∷怠⑾肪绲鹊娘級情节，构思 5. 背景情况；真情；情况；详情 6. 来历，经历 7. [古语]历史 8. 锛埗允挛锏娘級描述，叙述 9. [口语、儿语]假话，谎话；说谎者 10. [美国英语]锛埿挛棚級报道，新闻报道的题材 vt. 1. 用历史故事画装饰

entry.def: A story is a description of imaginary people and events, which is written or told in order to entertain.

example.ex: The second story in the book is titled 'The Scholar'...
example.tran: 书中的第二个故事题为《学者》。

example.ex: I shall tell you a story about four little rabbits.
example.tran: 我要给你讲一个 4 只小兔子的故事。

entry.def: A story is a description of an event or something that happened to someone, especially a spoken description of it.

example.ex: The parents all shared interesting stories about their children...
example.tran: 父母之间都会分享自己孩子的一些趣事。

example.ex: Isak's story is typical of a child who has a specific learning disability.
example.tran: 伊萨克的故事就是一个具有某种学习障碍的孩子的典型故事。

entry.def: The story of something is a description of all the important things that have happened to it since it began.

example.ex: ...the story of the women's movement in Ireland.
example.tran: 爱尔兰妇女运动的记载

entry.def: If someone invents a story, they give a false explanation or account of something.

example.ex: He invented some story about a cousin.
example.tran: 他骗别人说自己有位堂兄。

entry.def: A news story is a piece of news in a newspaper or in a news broadcast.

example.ex: Those are some of the top stories in the news...
example.tran: 那些是报纸上的头条新闻。

example.ex: They'll do anything for a story.
example.tran: 他们为抢到新闻会不择手段。

entry.tran: 但那是另一回事了;那就不相干了
entry.def: You say 'but that's another story' when you have mentioned a subject that you are not going to talk about or explain in detail.

example.ex: I'd met him at a dance I'd gone to on my own. But that's another story.
example.tran: 我有一次独自去参加舞会时遇上了他。但那是题外话了。

entry.def: In British English, you use to cut a long story short to indicate that you are going to state the final result of an event and not give any more details. In American English, you say to make a long story short .

example.ex: To cut a long story short, I ended up as managing director.
example.tran: 长话短说，我最终当上了总经理。

entry.tran: 另一回事，不同情况(通常指不好的一面)
entry.def: You use a different story to refer to a situation, usually a bad one, which exists in one set of circumstances when you have mentioned that it does not exist in another set of circumstances.

example.ex: Where Marcella lives, the rents are fairly cheap, but a little further north it's a different story.
example.tran: 玛塞拉居住的地方，租金比较便宜，但稍稍再往北一点情况就不同了。

entry.tran: 又来了，又是老一套(表示不好的事情似乎总是重复发生)
entry.def: If you say it's the same old story or it's the old story, you mean that something unpleasant or undesirable seems to happen again and again.

example.ex: It's the same old story. They want one person to do three people's jobs.
example.tran: 又是老一套。他们想让 1 个人做 3 个人的工作。

entry.tran: 不是事情的全部;只是部分情况
entry.def: If you say that something is only part of the story or is not the whole story, you mean that the explanation or information given is not enough for a situation to be fully understood.

example.ex: This may be true but it is only part of the story...
example.tran: 这可能是真的，但它并不是事情的全部。

example.ex: Jane goes to great lengths to explain that this is not the whole story.
example.tran: 简竭力地解释说那不是事情的全貌。

entry.def: If someone tells you their side of the story, they tell you why they behaved in a particular way and why they think they were right, when other people think that person behaved wrongly.

example.ex: He had already made up his mind before even hearing her side of the story.
example.tran: 他没等听到她的解释就已经作出了决定。

means.word_mean: 1. a message that tells the particulars of an act or occurrence or course of events; presented in writing or drama or cinema or as a radio or television program;

sentences.sentence: "Disney's stories entertain adults as well as children"

means.word_mean: 2. a piece of fiction that narrates a chain of related events;
3. structure consisting of a room or set of rooms comprising a single level of a multilevel building;
4. a record or narrative description of past events;

sentences.sentence: "he gave an inaccurate account of the plot to kill the president"

means.word_mean: 5. a short account of the news;

sentences.sentence: "the story was on the 11 o'clock news"
"the account of his speech that was given on the evening news made the governor furious"
"he told a fib about eating his spinach"
"how can I stop my child from telling stories?"

means.word_mean: 故事; 传说; 小说

sentences.en: He likes to listen to fairy stories.

The teacher told him off for telling stories.
They live in three storys building.

jushi.english: The old lady sobbed out the story of her son's death in a traffic accident.
jushi.chinese: 那老太太抽抽搭搭地哭诉他儿子死于交通事故的经过。

jushi.english: Children like to listen to fairy stories.
jushi.chinese: 孩子们喜欢听童话故事。
